Please implement this method to return the absolute shortest distance between two specified string.

For example,
o Input: ([ab, bc, cd, de, ef, abc, def, ghi], cd, ghi), Output: 4
o Input: ([a, b, c, d, 1, 2, 3, a, 2, b], a, 1) Output: 2


*/

return 0;}

public static void main(String arr[])
{
/* Main Method*/
}

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void shortestFinder1(){ String [] input_array = {"ab", "bc", "cd", "de", "ef", "ab", "def", "ghi"}; String first="ab";String second="de";assertEquals(1, shortestFinder(input_array,first,second));}

@Test public void shortestFinder2(){ String [] input_array = {"a", "b", "c", "d", "1", "2", "3", "a", "2", "b"}; String first="a";String second="1";assertEquals(2, shortestFinder(input_array,first,second));}
@Test public void shortestFinder3(){ String [] input_array = {"a", "b", "d", "1", "3", "a", "1", "b"}; String first="a";String second="1";assertEquals(0, shortestFinder(input_array,first,second));}

@Test public void shortestFinder4(){ String [] input_array = {"ab", "bc", "cd", "de", "ef", "abc", "def", "ghi"}; String first="cd";String second="ghi";assertEquals(4, shortestFinder(input_array,first,second));}

@Test public void shortestFinder5(){ String [] input_array = {"3", "a", "2", "abc","b", "def","3", "ghi"}; String first="3";String second="abc";assertEquals(2, shortestFinder(input_array,first,second));}

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void findEqualSum1(){int[] temp_array = {1, 2, 5, 3, 8, 4, 6}; int n=7;assertEquals(3, findEqualSum(temp_array,n));}
@Test public void findEqualSum2(){int[] temp_array = {10, 20, 15, 25, 35, 5, 45}; int n=50;assertEquals(2, findEqualSum(temp_array,n));}
@Test public void findEqualSum3(){int[] temp_array = {3,10,16,17,12,5}; int n=20;assertEquals(1, findEqualSum(temp_array,n));}
@Test public void findEqualSum4(){int[] temp_array = {6,12,25,0,8,5,9}; int n=25;assertEquals(1, findEqualSum(temp_array,n));}
@Test public void findEqualSum5(){int[] temp_array = {12,5,17,7,3,9,23,21}; int n=5;assertEquals(0, findEqualSum(temp_array,n));}

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void sortIgnoringSpacesTest11(){String[] temp_array = {"john","hari","poter"}; String[] temp_answer = {"hari","john","poter"};Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(temp_answer,sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)));}

@Test public void sortIgnoringSpacesTest21(){String[] temp_array = {"shiv raj","shivrej","shiva"}; String[] temp_answer = {"shiv raj","shiva","shivrej"};Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(temp_answer,sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)));}

@Test public void sortIgnoringSpacesTest31(){String[] temp_array = {"Raaj","raaj","rAaj","RA Aj"}; String[] temp_answer = {"RA Aj","Raaj","rAaj","raaj"};Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(temp_answer,sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)));}

@Test public void sortIgnoringSpacesTest41(){String[] temp_array = {"J o h n","john","joHn","J o H n"}; String[] temp_answer = {"J o H n","J o h n","joHn","john"}; System.out.println(sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)[0]); Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(temp_answer,sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)));}

@Test public void sortIgnoringSpacesTest51(){String[] temp_array = {"mery","MERY","mery","MERYY"}; String[] temp_answer = {"MERY","MERYY","mery","mery"}; Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(temp_answer,sortIgnoringSpaces(temp_array)));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which of the following statements are true regarding static keyword in Java

OPTIONS.OPTION: Static methods of Class cannot access private instance (non-static) methods of the same class
Static methods cannot be private
Static methods of Class cannot access private instance (non-static) variables of the same class
Instance methods of a class cannot access static variables of the same class
Instance methods of a class can access static methods of the same class
This code would give compilation error at line 3, as static method f1() cannot call non-static method f2()
This code would give compilation error at line 6, as non-static method f2() cannot call static method f1()
This code would compile successfully
his code will give compilation error at line 6, as to call static method f1() it needs to be called using Class name i.e. X.f1()
Instance methods of a class can access static methods of the same class

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How is IP address assigned to your computer when connected to a network

OPTIONS.OPTION: IP address of the computer needs to be provided manually otherwise it will not get IP address
DHCP (Dynamic Host Control Protocol) server provides IP address to the computer
User can manually configure the IP address of the computer
Computer broadcasts a DHCP request in the network to find the DHCP server
IP address of Address of DHCP server is pre-configured in the computer

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Paging is one of the memory management schemes by which a computer can store and retrieve data from secondary storage for use in main memory. Please mark statements as correct or incorrect in context of Paging concept used in Operating System

OPTIONS.OPTION: In the paging memory-management scheme, the operating system retrieves data from secondary storage in blocks called pages
The blocks can be of different size within the same paging memory-management scheme
Paging is part of virtual memory implementation in operating systems, allowing them to use disk storage for data that does not fit into physical random-access memory (RAM)
The main functions of paging are performed when a program tries to access pages that are not currently mapped to physical memory (RAM). This situation is known as a page fault

The difference between paging and segmentation is that with paging the system allocates memory and with segmentation memory is allocated to a specific function. Paging has no shared code and segmentation does
